law.catch_line: Duties of Office of Financial Management -- Contents of state debt report.

text.section: The Office of Financial Management shall render monthly written reports concerning the performance of each investment to the State Investment Commission.
The Office of Financial Management shall review state appropriation-supported bond issues for possible debt service savings through refundings as market conditions warrant.

The Office of Financial Management shall submit a report within forty-five (45) days after the publication of the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report to the Legislative Research Commission, for referral to the appropriate committee, indicating the bond issues refunded, original and new interest rates, estimated savings, original and new amortization schedules, issuance costs, debt reserves, disposition of savings, and information on economic, fiscal, and market indicators of the Commonwealth's debt position.

The state debt report shall include, but not be limited to, economic, fiscal, and market indicators of debt position as set forth in this section. Indicators shall be presented in tabular and, where appropriate, graphical form. Indicators shall be presented for the fiscal year just ended and, if data is available and except as otherwise noted, for the preceding nine (9) fiscal years.
Fiscal indicators shall be reported separately and in total for the general fund, the road fund, and each restricted fund account from which debt service is expended.

Fiscal indicators shall include:
Annual appropriation-supported debt service as a percent of total revenues; and
Annual appropriation-supported debt service as a percent of available revenues.

The state debt report shall contain a complete description of the sources of data used to prepare the report. This description shall include, but not be limited to, an enumeration, by fund and restricted fund account, of all debt, debt service, and revenue figures; the source and publication date of figures used for state total personal income, total assessed value of property, population, and selected bond indexes.

If the sources of data used in a current report differ substantially from those used in the report of the preceding year, the report shall include a detailed explanation of the change. If possible, data presented in the current report for previous years shall be calculated so that, in any one (1) report, indicators for all years are calculated using consistent data categories. The use of any inconsistent data shall be noted and explained.
Nothing in this section shall authorize any act inconsistent with the authority granted the State Investment Commission by KRS 42.500 and 42.525.

metadata.lrc-note: (11/21/2011). The Reviser of Statutes has corrected a manifest clerical or typographical error in the reference to "KRS 42.4201" in subsection (1) of this statute. The correct reference is to KRS 42.0201, which created the Office of Financial Management, and that change has been made under the authority of KRS 7.136.
